Operation 'Deleteindexbyname' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks critical details about what gets deleted, side effects on query performance, and what the response contains. Added context about permanent deletion, performance implications, permission requirements, and response behavior for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description: Deletes an [index](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/master-data-components#index).
data.description_suggestion: Removes an index from the specified data entity by name. This operation permanently deletes the index configuration, which may impact query performance for searches that relied on this index. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Remove index or Master Data administrator role). Returns a success response with no content on successful deletion.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks critical details about what gets deleted, side effects on query performance, and what the response contains. Added context about permanent deletion, performance implications, permission requirements, and response behavior for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'Validatedocumentbyclusters' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Summary is vague about what 'clusters' means in this context. Description lacks input requirements (document ID, cluster specifications), output format, and practical use cases. Added domain context about cluster definitions, request limits, required inputs, response format, and use cases to improve AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
Checks if a document is present in one or more clusters (specific set of field values).

> There is a limit of five rules per request.
data.summary_suggestion: Check document membership in field value clusters
data.description_suggestion: Validates whether a document matches one or more cluster definitions (specific combinations of field values). Accepts up to five cluster rules per request. Requires a document ID and cluster specifications in the request body. Returns validation results indicating which clusters, if any, the document belongs to. Useful for data quality checks and document categorization based on field value patterns.
data.reasoning: Summary is vague about what 'clusters' means in this context. Description lacks input requirements (document ID, cluster specifications), output format, and practical use cases. Added domain context about cluster definitions, request limits, required inputs, response format, and use cases to improve AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'Listversions' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary is too generic ('List versions' could apply to many contexts). Description lacks information about what the response contains, pagination support, and how versions are generated. Enhanced with details about version tracking, response structure, and pagination capabilities for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description:
Lists the versions of a document.

> Master Data documents are versioned. This means that, for each change, a new version is generated.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all versions of a document
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a list of all versions for a specific document in the data entity. Master Data automatically creates a new version with each document change, allowing you to track the complete modification history. Returns an array of version objects containing version metadata and timestamps. Supports pagination parameters to control the number of results returned.
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic ('List versions' could apply to many contexts). Description lacks information about what the response contains, pagination support, and how versions are generated. Enhanced with details about version tracking, response structure, and pagination capabilities for better AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

message: Operation 'Getversion' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Summary is too generic and doesn't specify 'specific version' retrieval. Description lacks details about what gets returned (full document content), the version ID parameter requirement, and practical use cases. Added specificity about version ID parameter, complete document content retrieval, and use cases for auditing and data recovery.

data.current_description:
Returns the version of a document.

> Master Data documents are versioned. This means that, for each change, a new version is generated.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a specific version of a document by version ID. Master Data maintains complete version history, with a new version created for each document modification. Returns the full document content as it existed in that specific version, including all fields and their values at that point in time. Useful for auditing changes, recovering previous data states, or comparing document evolution.
data.reasoning: Summary is too generic and doesn't specify 'specific version' retrieval. Description lacks details about what gets returned (full document content), the version ID parameter requirement, and practical use cases. Added specificity about version ID parameter, complete document content retrieval, and use cases for auditing and data recovery.

message: Operation 'Putversion' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, unclear_purpose, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary 'Update version' is ambiguous - unclear if it modifies version metadata or restores to a version. Description is vague about the actual operation (appears to be a restore/revert operation based on PUT semantics). Missing critical details about what parameters are needed, what gets returned, and that restoration creates a new version entry. Clarified the operation as a version restoration with complete input/output details.

data.current_description:
Updates the document's version value.

> Master Data documents are versioned. This means that, for each change, a new version is generated.
data.summary_suggestion: Restore document to a previous version
data.description_suggestion: Restores a document to a specific previous version by version ID. This operation reverts the document's current state to match the specified historical version, effectively undoing all changes made after that version was created. Requires the document ID and target version ID as parameters. Returns the restored document with its previous content and metadata. Note: This creates a new version entry in the version history reflecting the restoration action.
data.reasoning: Original summary 'Update version' is ambiguous - unclear if it modifies version metadata or restores to a version. Description is vague about the actual operation (appears to be a restore/revert operation based on PUT semantics). Missing critical details about what parameters are needed, what gets returned, and that restoration creates a new version entry. Clarified the operation as a version restoration with complete input/output details.

data.current_description: Returns an existing [schema](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/master-data-schema-lifecycle) for a given data entity.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve schema definition for data entity
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves an existing schema definition for a specified data entity and schema name. Returns the complete schema object containing the JSON Schema structure and validation rules. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions to access schema information.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. message: Operation 'Saveschemabyname' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary doesn't clearly indicate the create-or-update behavior. Description is scattered and lacks clarity about inputs (request body structure), outputs (what is returned), and constraints (60 schema limit). Enhanced version consolidates information, clarifies the idempotent nature of the operation, specifies input/output, and highlights the 60-schema limit constraint for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Creates or edits a data entity schema. Learn more about [Master Data schemas](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/master-data-schema-lifecycle). 

> Note that if you send a `schemaName` that does not exist for that data entity, this request will create it.

This request can also be used to [create or edit Master Data v2 triggers](https://developers.vtex.com/vtex-rest-api/docs/setting-up-triggers-in-master-data-v2). 

> Each Master Data v2 data entity can have up to 60 schemas.
data.summary_suggestion: Create or update data entity schema
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new schema or updates an existing schema for a data entity. Accepts a JSON Schema definition in the request body. If the specified schemaName does not exist, it will be created; otherwise the existing schema will be replaced. Can also be used to configure Master Data v2 triggers. Note: Each data entity is limited to 60 schemas maximum. Returns the saved schema object. Requires Master Data administrator permissions.
data.reasoning: Original summary doesn't clearly indicate the create-or-update behavior. Description is scattered and lacks clarity about inputs (request body structure), outputs (what is returned), and constraints (60 schema limit). Enhanced version consolidates information, clarifies the idempotent nature of the operation, specifies input/output, and highlights the 60-schema limit constraint for better AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'Deleteschemabyname' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. Original summary is generic. Description lacks critical information about side effects (permanent deletion, cannot be undone), response format (204 No Content), and the irreversible nature of the operation. data.current_description: Deletes an existing [schema](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/master-data-schema-lifecycle) for a given data entity.
data.description_suggestion: Permanently deletes an existing schema from a data entity. Requires the schema name and data entity name as parameters. This operation removes the schema definition and any associated validation rules. Returns a success response (204 No Content) on successful deletion. Requires Master Data administrator permissions. This action cannot be undone.
data.reasoning: Original summary is generic. Description lacks critical information about side effects (permanent deletion, cannot be undone), response format (204 No Content), and the irreversible nature of the operation. Enhanced version clarifies the destructive nature, response code, and emphasizes the permanent consequences for AI agents to understand the operation's impact.

message: Operation 'Createnewdocument' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity about return values and side effects. Enhanced summary specifies auto-generated ID behavior. Improved description clarifies that data entity is auto-created if needed, specifies return information (ID, timestamp, version), and mentions permission requirements for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Creates a new document with an ID automatically generated by VTEX, corresponding to a new or existing data entity. If an unexisting `dataEntityName` is informed in the path, this endpoint will create the data entity as well as the new document. For example, you can create a new customer profile or address.

> You can use this request to create documents for any data entity. Because of this, you are not restricted to using the fields exemplified below in your requests. However you should be aware of the fields allowed or required for each document you wish to create.

> To create a document with a custom ID, refer to the [Create document with custom ID](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/api-reference/master-data-api-v2#put-/api/dataentities/-dataEntityName-/documents/-id-) endpoint.
data.summary_suggestion: Create new document with auto-generated ID
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new document with an automatically generated ID in the specified data entity. If the data entity does not exist, it will be created automatically. Accepts any JSON document structure compliant with the data entity schema. Returns the created document with its generated ID, creation timestamp, and version information. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions for document insertion or full access.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic. Description lacks clarity about return values and side effects. Enhanced summary specifies auto-generated ID behavior. Improved description clarifies that data entity is auto-created if needed, specifies return information (ID, timestamp, version), and mentions permission requirements for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'Createorupdatepartialdocument' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, unclear_purpose, missing_output_details. Original summary is ambiguous about create vs. update behavior. Description is unclear about whether it creates or updates. Enhanced summary clarifies both operations. Improved description explicitly states create-or-update semantics, clarifies partial update behavior (only provided fields modified), specifies return information, and mentions permission requirements for better AI agent interpretability.

data.current_description:
This request allows you to partially update a document corresponding to a given data entity.

> You can use this request to create documents for any given data entity. Because of this, you are not restricted to using the fields exemplified below in your requests. But you should be aware of the fields allowed or required for each document you wish to update.
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new document or partially updates an existing document in the specified data entity. Only provided fields are modified; omitted fields remain unchanged. If the document does not exist, it will be created with the provided fields. Accepts any JSON document structure compliant with the data entity schema. Returns the created or updated document with its ID, modification timestamp, and version information. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions for document insertion or updates.
data.reasoning: Original summary is ambiguous about create vs. update behavior. Description is unclear about whether it creates or updates. Enhanced summary clarifies both operations. Improved description explicitly states create-or-update semantics, clarifies partial update behavior (only provided fields modified), specifies return information, and mentions permission requirements for better AI agent interpretability.

message: Operation 'Getdocument' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, missing_output_details. Original summary is too generic and doesn't mention field selection capability. Description lacks details about field selection syntax and return values. Enhanced summary includes field selection feature. Improved description clarifies field selection mechanism, provides usage examples, specifies return information including metadata, and mentions permission requirements for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Retrieves a document by ID.

> Assign the `_fields` parameter in the query string to retrieve the desired fields. If you want to return all the fields use `_fields=_all`.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve document by ID with field selection
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves a document from the specified data entity by its ID. Supports selective field retrieval using the `_fields` query parameter to optimize response payload. Use `_fields=_all` to retrieve all document fields, or specify comma-separated field names for targeted retrieval. Returns the document object with requested fields, including metadata such as ID, creation timestamp, and version information. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions for document read access.
data.reasoning: Original summary is too generic and doesn't mention field selection capability. Description lacks details about field selection syntax and return values. Enhanced summary includes field selection feature. Improved description clarifies field selection mechanism, provides usage examples, specifies return information including metadata, and mentions permission requirements for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'Updateentiredocument' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details. Original summary is wordy and uses 'update entire document' which is unclear. Description lacks clarity about full replacement semantics and return values. Enhanced summary uses 'replace' terminology which is clearer than 'update entire' and specifies custom ID. Improved description clarifies upsert behavior, emphasizes full replacement (not partial), specifies return information, and mentions permission requirements for better AI agent understanding.

data.current_summary: Create document with custom ID or update entire document
data.current_description:
Creates a new document with a custom ID, or updates an entire document if there is already a document with the informed ID. For example, you can update a customer profile or address.

> You can use this request to create or update documents in any given data entity. Because of this, you are not restricted to using the fields exemplified below in your requests. But you should be aware of the fields allowed or required for each document you wish to update.
data.summary_suggestion: Create or replace document with specified ID
data.description_suggestion: Creates a new document with a specified custom ID, or replaces an entire existing document if a document with that ID already exists. This is an upsert operation that performs a full document replacement, not a partial update. Accepts any JSON document structure compliant with the data entity schema. Returns the created or updated document with its ID, modification timestamp, and version information. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions for document insertion or updates.
data.reasoning: Original summary is wordy and uses 'update entire document' which is unclear. Description lacks clarity about full replacement semantics and return values. Enhanced summary uses 'replace' terminology which is clearer than 'update entire' and specifies custom ID. Improved description clarifies upsert behavior, emphasizes full replacement (not partial), specifies return information, and mentions permission requirements for better AI agent understanding.

message: Operation 'Updatepartialdocument' has semantic quality issues: missing_output_details. Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description lacks details about return values and side effects. Enhanced description clarifies that only provided fields are modified, specifies return information including metadata (ID, timestamp, version), and mentions permission requirements for AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
This request allows you to partially update a document corresponding to a given data entity. For example, you can update some fields of a customer profile or address.

> You can use this request to update documents for any given data entity. Because of this, you are not restricted to using the fields exemplified below in your requests. But you should be aware of the fields allowed or required for each document you wish to update.
data.description_suggestion: Partially updates a document in the specified data entity by ID. Only provided fields are modified; omitted fields and existing document structure remain unchanged. Accepts any JSON document structure compliant with the data entity schema. Returns the updated document with its ID, modification timestamp, and version information. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions for document updates or full access.
data.reasoning: Summary is clear and action-oriented. Description lacks details about return values and side effects. Enhanced description clarifies that only provided fields are modified, specifies return information including metadata (ID, timestamp, version), and mentions permission requirements for AI agent decision-making.

message: Operation 'Deletedocument' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects, poor_ai_interpretability. Original summary and description are too minimal. The description lacks critical context about permanence, what gets deleted, required permissions, and expected response. AI agents need to understand this is a destructive operation with side effects. Added specificity about data entity context, irreversibility, permission requirements, and response behavior for better AI interpretability.

data.current_description: Deletes a document.
data.summary_suggestion: Delete a document from a data entity
data.description_suggestion: Permanently removes a document from the specified data entity by its ID. This operation is irreversible and will delete all data associated with the document. Requires appropriate License Manager permissions (Full access to all documents or Master Data administrator role). Returns a success response with no content on successful deletion.
data.reasoning: Original summary and description are too minimal. The description lacks critical context about permanence, what gets deleted, required permissions, and expected response. AI agents need to understand this is a destructive operation with side effects. Added specificity about data entity context, irreversibility, permission requirements, and response behavior for better AI interpretability.

message: Operation 'Searchdocuments' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Summary is too generic. Description is lengthy but lacks clear guidance on when to use this vs. Scroll endpoint, parameter usage patterns, and rate limiting implications. Reorganized to emphasize key capabilities, parameter types, pagination behavior, and critical warnings about performance. Added context about choosing between Search and Scroll for better AI agent decision-making.

data.current_description:
Retrieves Master Data v2 documents' information, while choosing which fields will be returned and filtering documents by specific fields. 

> The response header `REST-Content-Range` indicates the total amount of results for that specific search. For example, it may return `resources 0-100/136108`, which indicates it has returned the first 100 results out of a total of 136108.

Below you can see some query examples and learn more about each query parameter.

Learn more about [Pagination in the Master Data API](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/pagination-in-the-master-data-api). 

> Avoid sending too many requests with wildcards (`*`) in the search parameters or that use the `keyword` parameter. This may lead to this endpoint being temporarily blocked for your account. If this happens you will receive an error with status code `503`.

## Query examples

| **Query Type** | **Example** |
|-|-|
| **Simple filter** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/search?email=my@email.com` |
| **Complex filter** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/search?_where=(firstName=Jon OR lastName=Smith) OR (createdIn between 2001-01-01 AND 2016-01-01)` |
 | **Date range** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/search?_where=createdIn between 2001-01-01 AND 2016-01-01` |
| **Range numeric fields** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/search?_where=age between 18 AND 25` |
| **Partial filter** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/search?firstName=*Maria*` |
| **Filter for null values** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/search?_where=firstName is null` |
| **Filter for non-null values** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/search?_where=firstName is not null` |
| **Filter for difference** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/search?_where=firstName<>maria` |
| **Filter greater than** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/search?_where=number>5` |
| **Filter less than** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/search?_where=date<2001-01-01` |
data.summary_suggestion: Query documents with filters and field selection
data.description_suggestion: Searches and retrieves documents from a data entity with flexible filtering and field selection. Supports simple filters (e.g., email=value), complex filters using _where parameter with AND/OR operators, date ranges, numeric ranges, partial matches with wildcards, and null checks. Returns paginated results with REST-Content-Range header indicating total count. Use _fields parameter to specify which document fields to return. Avoid excessive wildcard (*) or keyword searches to prevent rate limiting (503 errors). For large datasets (>10000 documents), use the Scroll endpoint instead.

message: Operation 'Scrolldocuments' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_input_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Summary is too vague. Description is detailed but scattered across multiple sections, making it hard for AI agents to understand the core workflow and when to use this vs. Search. Reorganized to emphasize: use case (large datasets), token-based pagination workflow, token lifecycle, parameter requirements per request, filtering capabilities, and rate limiting. Clearer structure helps AI agents understand the multi-step nature and when to invoke this operation.

data.current_description:
Returns a list of documents according to query parameter filters. If you need to query the entire database, or your collection is over 10000 documents, use this endpoint.

In the first request, the `X-VTEX-MD-TOKEN` token will be obtained in the response header. This token must be passed to the next request in the `_token` query string parameter. The token expires after 20 minutes of inactivity, and each request made with the token during this time resets the expiration timer.

After the token is obtained, it is no longer necessary to send the filter or document size per page parameters. You only need to resend the token until the document collection is empty. 

First request:
```
/dataentities/Newsletter/scroll?isCluster=true&_size=250&_fields=email,firstName 
```

Retrieve the token in the header `X-VTEX-MD-TOKEN` from the first request's response and use it to make the following requests.

Subsequent requests:
```
/dataentities/Newsletter/scroll?_token={tokenValue}
 ```

Learn more about [Pagination in the Master Data API](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/pagination-in-the-master-data-api). 

> Avoid sending too many requests with wildcards (`*`) in the search parameters or using the `keyword` parameter. This may lead to this endpoint being temporarily blocked for your account. If this happens you will receive an error with status code `429`.

## Query examples

| **Query Type** | **Example** |
|-|-|
| **Simple filter** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/scroll?email=my@email.com` |
| **Complex filter** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/scroll?_where=(firstName=Jon OR lastName=Smith) OR (createdIn between 2001-01-01 AND 2016-01-01)` |
 | **Date range** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/scroll?_where=createdIn between 2001-01-01 AND 2016-01-01` |
| **Range numeric fields** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/scroll?_where=age between 18 AND 25` |
| **Partial filter** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/scroll?firstName=*Maria*` |
| **Filter for null values** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/scroll?_where=firstName is null` |
| **Filter for non-null values** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/scroll?_where=firstName is not null` |
| **Filter for difference** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/scroll?_where=firstName<>maria` |
| **Filter greater than** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/scroll?_where=number>5` |
| **Filter less than** | `/dataentities/Newsletter/scroll?_where=date<2001-01-01` |
data.summary_suggestion: Paginate through large document collections efficiently
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves documents from a data entity using cursor-based pagination, optimized for large datasets (>10000 documents) or full database queries. First request returns an X-VTEX-MD-TOKEN in response header; pass this token in subsequent _token parameter to continue pagination. Token expires after 20 minutes of inactivity; each request resets the timer. After initial request, only the token parameter is neededfilters and _size are not required. Supports same filtering options as Search endpoint (_where, date ranges, numeric ranges, partial matches). Returns empty collection when all documents are retrieved. Avoid excessive wildcards or keyword searches to prevent rate limiting (429 errors).

message: Operation 'Getschemas' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, vague_description, missing_output_details, poor_ai_interpretability. Summary is too generic. Description is minimal and lacks context about what schemas are, what the response contains, and why an agent would use this operation. Added explanation of schema purpose, response structure, use case context, and permission requirements to improve AI agent understanding of when and how to use this operation.

data.current_description: Retrieves all existing [schemas](https://developers.vtex.com/docs/guides/master-data-schema-lifecycle) for a given data entity.
data.summary_suggestion: Retrieve all schemas for a data entity
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves all JSON schemas defined for a specified data entity. Schemas define the structure, validation rules, and field properties for documents in that entity. Returns a collection of schema objects, each containing the schema name, version, and JSON schema definition. Use this to discover available schemas before creating or validating documents. Requires read-level permissions on the data entity.
